adverb.description: Used to confirm or support a point or idea just mentioned.
examples: I told you, it's all right, and anyway, it was my fault

adverb.description: Used to end a conversation, to change the subject, or to resume a subject after interruption.
examples: How she lives with him is beyond me. Anyway, I really like her

adverb.description: Used to indicate that something happened or will happen in spite of something else.
examples: nobody invited Miss Honey to sit down so she sat down anyway
